title: Urban gardening for dummies
description:
Title: 	Urban gardening for dummies	

Author(s):	The National Gardening Association, Paul Simon, Charlie Nardozzi

Series:	For dummies (Home & garden)	

Publisher:	Wiley	City:	

Year:	2013	Edition:	1

Language:	English

The easy way to succeed at urban gardeningA townhouse yard, a balcony, a fire escape, a south-facing windowÃ¢â‚¬â€even a basement apartment can all be suitable locations to grow enough food to save a considerable amount of money and enjoy the freshest, healthiest produce possible.Urban Gardening For Dummies helps you make the most of limited space through the use of proven small-space gardening techniques that allow gardeners to maximize yield while minimizing space.Covers square-foot gardening and vertical and layered gardeningIncludes guidance on working with container gardening, succession gardening, and companion gardeningOffers guidance on pest management, irrigation and rain barrels, and small-space compostingIf you're interested in starting an urban garden that makes maximum use of minimal space, Urban Gardening For Dummies has you covered
